channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Beheading exposes exploitation
item.description: Rizana Nafeek was a child herself -- 17 years old according to her birth certificate -- when a four-month-old baby died in her care in Saudi Arabia. She had migrated from Sri Lanka only weeks earlier to be a domestic worker for a Saudi family.

item.title: Bergen: Abandon Afghanistan? Dumb
item.description: Peter Bergen says even floating the idea of pulling all U.S. troops out is dangerous

item.title: Kurtz: Survival strategy for writers
item.description: Howard Kurtz says Andrew Sullivan is asking readers to pay for his blog, part of the new reality of journalists' self-branding.

item.title: Latino should have played lead in 'Argo'
item.description: Ruben Navarrette says the real-life hero in Ben Affleck's film "Argo" was a Latino, and it would have made sense to have a Latino play him.

item.title: Government to review Boeing's Dreamliner
item.description: After a week of problems with the Boeing 787 Dreamliner, the Department of Transportation will announce a comprehensive review of the state-of-the-art jetliner.

item.title: Can airliners really fly upside down?
item.description: The pilot turned his airliner upside down. On purpose. And it saved nearly a hundred lives.

item.title: Police: BBC presenter abused hundreds
item.description: Britain's late TV presenter and radio host Jimmy Savile sexually abused hundreds of people and carried out more than 30 rapes, police said Friday, as they unveiled a report exposing "vast, predatory and opportunistic" abuses over six decades.

item.title: Next up for Karzai: Obama, Afghanistan
item.description: Years of tensions between Afghan President Hamid Karzai and the U.S. government appeared to fade away like a bad dream, at least in public, when Karzai touched down in Washington this week.

item.title: More rain for flooded Louisiana
item.description: As water levels already at or above flood stage continue rising in rivers in southwestern Louisiana, the weather forecast says more rain is on the way.

item.title: Planned Parenthood seeks injunction
item.description: Planned Parenthood in Texas heads to federal court Friday, looking for a temporary injunction that would allow it to take part in the state's revamped Women's Health Program.

item.title: Aurora suspect ordered to stand trial
item.description: A Colorado judge ruled Thursday that probable cause exists in the case of James Holmes, who is accused of killing 12 people and wounding scores of others in last summer's shooting inside an Aurora movie theater, and ordered that he stand trial.

item.title: NYPD: Suspect targeted iconic arch
item.description: A man arrested on suspicion of possession of an explosive substance allegedly told people he planned to blow up the iconic arch in New York City's Washington Square Park, authorities say.

item.title: Robber brings knife to a gunfight
item.description: A store clerk pulls a gun on an individual who tries to take money from the cash register.

item.title: FDA seeks lower doses for sleep drugs
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration is requiring manufactures of insomnia products to lower the recommended doses.

item.title: World wastes half its food, study finds
item.description: Up to half of the world's food is wasted, according to a new report that found production inefficiencies in developing countries and market and consumer waste in more advanced societies.

item.title: Amazon giving you free MP3s for CDs
item.description: Amazon has launched AutoRip, a service that gives customers free MP3 versions of CDs they've purchased anytime since 1998.

item.title: Seau's brain diseased, tests show
item.description: NFL linebacker Junior Seau, who took his life last May, suffered from a neurodegenerative brain disease that can follow multiple hits to the head, the National Institutes of Health said.

item.title: Baseball players to be tested for HGH
item.description: Major League Baseball and players have agreed to ramp up the battle against illicit performance-enhancing drugs by instituting in-season testing for human growth hormone.

item.title: Comics crack on Lew's signature
item.description: Jon Stewart and Jimmy Kimmel enjoy a good laugh at the expense of Treasury Secretary nominee Jack Lew's signature.

item.title: Conan, Gervais take bubble bath
item.description: Conan and Ricky Gervais take a bubble bath and tweet out the picture.

item.title: Sheriff: Student shooter felt bullied
item.description: After a 16-year-old shot a classmate in a California classroom, a teacher and school official talked him into giving up his shotgun, the local sheriff said.

item.title: 'Very troubled boy with hit list'
item.description: CNN's Kyung Lah talks to Taft Union High School students and parents about what they knew of the alleged shooter.

item.title: Rifle-toting men cause panic
item.description: Two men carrying assault rifles through Portland tell KPTV they were simply exercising their Second Amendment rights.

item.title: Mom shoots home invader 5 times
item.description: A Georgia woman shot a home intruder five times in an effort to protect her children. CNN's David Mattingly reports.

item.title: Armed mom the new face of gun rights
item.description: Clutching a gun she had just learned to shoot, Melinda Herman heard the intruder coming closer. What happened next made her the face of gun rights groups.

item.title: Biden: Gun recs to Obama Tuesday
item.description: The vice president has been meeting with disparate groups on various sides of the issue -- including some for and others against stricter gun controls.

item.title: Avlon: 3 areas Biden, NRA can agree
item.description: There are obviously deep divisions between the two, but they may find common ground on gun control, says John Avlon.

item.title: Marine vs. Marine: Debating gun laws
item.description: Gun rights advocate Joshua Bolton and fellow ex-Marine Nicolas DiOrio, who criticized Bolton's open letter on gun control laws, answer five questions for CNN iReport.

item.title: What is an assault weapon?
item.description: What qualifies as an assault weapon? CNN's Joe Johns provides the details and discusses what a potential ban would mean.

item.title: Is this hip-hop's finest MC?
item.description: In a genre not known for the longevity of its luminaries, making it 10, 15, 20 years means you're a survivor -- and you survive only if people keep buying your music. As Nas turns 40 this year, he's adapted to every sea change in rap and weathered every label, right or wrong, affixed to him.

item.title: ESPN star returns to TV after burns
item.description: ESPN's Hannah Storm returns to TV less than a month after serious burns from a propane tank explosion.

item.title: Are we ready for the next superstorm?
item.description: They hover above our heads, zooming in and taking pictures. The data collected by these powerful satellites have helped save countless lives by allowing meteorologists to warn people about dangerous storms. But as budgets shrink, aging satellites might not get the expensive repairs they need to operate.

item.title: Visit William Shatner's world
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon sits down with William Shatner to talk about why Shatner is revealing so much in his new stage show.

item.title: Greene: Don't allow phone use on planes
item.description: Bob Greene says it makes perfect sense that the FAA is considering letting passengers use electronic devices on take-off and landing. Just no talking on cell phones, please

item.title: Watch impressive 3-pointer
item.description: A basketball player in Lafayette, Indiana, nails a 3-point shot after she saves the ball from going out of bounds.

item.title: See how speedboat puts out fire
item.description: A speedboat causes a splash by using its splash to douse a fire. Wait till you see THIS move. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Shark finning thrives on Hong Kong's roofs
item.description: Shark finning thrives on Hong Kong's rooftops

item.title: Worst fast-food meals for sodium
item.description: Worst fast-food meals for sodium

item.title: Plane explodes on Vegas runway
item.description: Two people escaped from a small plane that exploded into flames in Las Vegas.

item.title: Photos: Stars chop off their locks
'Teen Mom' waxes toddler's unibrow
item.description: Farrah Abraham of MTV's "Teen Mom" defends her decision to wax her 3-year-old daughter's unibrow.

item.title: Clown scolded by judge in court
item.description: A clown charged with resisting arrest has his day in court, though the judge is not amused when he shows up in costume.

item.title: Invisible driver orders fast food
item.description: An invisible driver's prank drives takeout window workers nuts. CNN's Jeanne Moos speaks with a talking car seat.

item.title: New show 'too white'?
item.description: HBO's 'Girls' is the latest TV show depicting life in New York City without one of its most crucial elements: diversity.

item.title: Zimmerman's body language
item.description: An expert in body language says George Zimmerman showed signs of anger in court in Florida.

item.title: Anderson battles on 'Jeopardy!'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on the highs and lows of his past "Jeopardy" appearances and weighs his odds of winning.

item.title: Steinem on GOP and women
item.description: Activist and author Gloria Steinem analyzes the "war on women" and says extremists have taken over the Republican party.

item.title: Facebook fans 'lonely'?
item.description: A report on Facebook, Bill O'Reilly and the Fox "brand," Current TV"s new hire, a Pulitzer for a PA reporter, GMA rises

item.title: Working moms of CNN
item.description: CNN goes behind the scenes with the working moms on Suzanne Malveaux's team to see how they juggle it all.

item.title: Levon Helm remembered
item.description: Anderson Cooper takes a look back at the life of The Band's Levon Helm and his many contributions to music.

item.title: Man makes dating spreadsheet
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses the investment banker who created an elaborate spreadsheet to keep track of his dates.

item.title: Political dog tale duel
item.description: In the RidicuList, Anderson Cooper examines which candidate's dog tale will have a greater election impact.

item.title: Vanessa Williams' perfect man
item.description: Entertainer Vanessa Williams talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about "being properly in love" and relationships.

item.title: 'Only in America': Defending Axl Rose
item.description: Piers Morgan defends Axl Rose for deciding not to attend the Rock'N'Roll Hall of Fame induction of Guns N' Roses.

item.title: Rep. won't name 'Communists'
item.description: Rep. Allen West (R-FL) responds to criticism after he claimed a number of Democratic reps in Congress are Communists.

item.title: RidicuList: Quest for 'sexy veggies'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper riffs on a staple of Courtney Stodden's grocery list, "sexy veggies."

item.title: Kim Kardashian for mayor?
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses Kim Kardashian's comments about running for Mayor in Glendale, California.

item.title: New judge in Martin case
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to a panel of analysts about the new judge in the Trayvon Martin shooting case.

item.title: Photos: And the nominees aren't ...
Deaf woman: eBay discriminates
item.description: Melissa Earll owns stacks of classic comic books, baseball cards that include a young Hank Aaron and Whitey Ford and other collectibles she wants to sell.

item.title: The importance of a 'stop day'
item.description: For almost 2,000 years, Western culture stopped on Sunday for about 24 hours. We need to bring that back, one doctor says.

item.title: Massive shark off Florida coast
item.description: OCEARCH research group alerted Jacksonville Beach's police when they tracked "Mary Lee", the shark, near the surf zone.

item.title: Did trapped killer whales escape?
item.description: A group of killer whales that had been trapped beneath ice and in danger of dying in Canada's Hudson Bay have not been seen Thursday, authorities said.

item.title: Why she was told to kill her own child
item.description: CNN's Sumnima Udas examines the cycle of discrimination against women in India.

item.title: Model's frank talk: How I REALLY look
item.description: A Victoria's Secret supermodel says modeling is "not a career path" young girls should aspire to take.

item.title: How to 'take over' a brain
item.description: One of the hottest areas of science is optogenetics -- experiments with controlling an animal's brain through light. Leonard Mlodinow explains how the work could lead to insight for diseases such as Parkinson's.

item.title: Deepak Chopra: Secrets to a better brain
item.description: There are many books on the market that focus on treating the brain like any other organ of the body. To improve the brain, they advise eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep and avoiding toxins like alcohol and nicotine.

item.title: 10 European hot spots
item.description: Put these destinations on your travel radar

item.title: 2013's must-see TV
item.description: Your favorite shows are almost back.

item.title: The secret to a better brain
item.description: Chopra: Think your way to an inspired brain.

item.title: NIH: Flu epidemic 'has not yet peaked'
item.description: While the spread of flu appears to have slowed in parts of the South, the NIH warns that the flu epidemic has for the most part yet to peak.

item.title: NIH: Flu epidemic 'has not yet peaked'
item.description: Despite 2,257 flu-related hospitalizations confirmed by the CDC, a director at the National Institutes of Health warns the flu epidemic is "on the uptick."

item.title: I got the flu vaccine, am I covered?
item.description: So you got a flu vaccine this season, and you've been reading about the flu epidemic. You might be wondering: Will the vaccine keep me healthy?

item.title: Deadly signs to look for if your kid is sick
item.description: How will you know if the flu has crossed the line to become deadly? CNN's Elizabeth Cohen has the story.

item.title: I have the flu, now what?
item.description: You feel worse by the hour. Your joints ache, your head feels heavy, you can't stop coughing, you're freezing even as your temperature keeps climbing, your stomach is upset, even your eyes hurt.

item.title: Gun control
item.description: A federal task force looking for ways to curb gun violence will have a set of recommendations by Tuesday, Vice President Joe Biden announced Thursday.

item.title: Flu epidemic
item.description: The flu has been spreading fiercely across the United States, with more than half of states reporting widespread activity. The season has started earlier, and cases are more severe than last year, health officials say.

item.title: California shooting
item.description: The 16-year-old student showed up late to class armed with a 12-gauge shotgun.

item.title: MLB testing
item.description: Major League Baseball and players have agreed to ramp up the battle against illicit performance-enhancing drugs by instituting in-season testing for human growth hormone.

item.title: Dreamliner
item.description: A fire, a fuel leak, mechanical issues.

item.title: Syria
item.description: It's one more calamity for civilians caught in Syria's bloody war.

item.title: Aurora
item.description: A Colorado judge ruled Thursday that probable cause exists in the case of James Holmes, who is accused of killing 12 people and wounding scores of others in last summer's shooting inside an Aurora movie theater, and ordered that he stand trial.

item.title: Oscar nominations
item.description: "Lincoln," director Steven Spielberg's film about the 16th president and his battle to end slavery, topped the nominations for the 85th Academy Awards on Thursday, receiving 12 nods, including best picture.

item.title: Best of college bowl games
item.description: Photos: Best of college bowl games

item.title: Notable people we lost in 2012
item.description: Photos: Notable people we've lost in 2012

item.title: Unforgettable moments of 2012
item.description: 2012: The year in pictures

item.title: Amazing sports moments you missed
item.description: Photos: 75 amazing sports moments you missed this year
